Alternately, for this test purpose install a SerurityManager, and don't allow "exitVM" access. This way,  a security exception will be thrown, instead of exiting the VM.




Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...>

09/07/2001 23:46
Please respond to junit

       
        To:        junit@yahoogroups.com
        cc:        
        Subject:        Re: [junit] System.exit



> I've come across a method that I would like to write a test for but it calls
> System.exit within its definition. Is there any way that a test can be
> written for this situation?

If you can modify the code, I would refactor and split the method.  You can for example throw an exception instead of exiting or check a returned status (and exiting if the exception is caught or the status is an error one).

If your method is really worth testing, the amount of work to modify the method is very too small to start implementing a workaround with mock objects.

My 2c

-Vladimir
